lexUnit.name: trip.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: catch one's foot on something and stumble or fall.

sentence.text: One day as she tripped forward to greet me I had , without pausing to wonder if my embrace would be acceptable to her , bent down and kissed her .
I heard her trip across the floor and the door closed behind her .
On Grafton Street in November We tripped lightly along the ledge …
The reply tripped smoothly from her lips .
He had tried to begin the research several times but on each occasion found his mind tripping from thought to thought .

Barth himself later said that he had been like a man who , tripping in the darkness of the church tower , had accidentally caught hold of the bell-rope to steady himself and alarmed the whole countryside .
Tripping through the graveyard with its crusty old tombs and tippling slabs had made her uneasy even though it was broad daylight .

The silence and emptiness of the scene did not become apparent to her until she turned into the drive of the house and realized there were no other cars parked there , no gaily clad groups tripping towards the garden , no jazz band to summon them nor hired flunkeys to greet them , no pop of champagne corks nor buzz of conversation , no bunting , no balloons , no merriment of any kind .
He touched a lump of rotting offal and , scooping it up , throwing it at the first assassin now tripping towards him .
I tripped back down the curving stairs , half-expecting a Busby Berkeley chorus to break into song .
On seeing the car , she rose immediately and came tripping down the drive to unlock the tall iron gates .
Sophisticated young women , with toned-down Irish accents , tripped in and out of expensive perfume and handbag shops .
The young men in their bottle-green trousers and gold lamý waistcoats tripped in and out of the kitchen , their trays piled high , the washers-up were elbow-deep in suds .
This all tripped off the fräulein 's tongue with uncharacteristic facility .
Names trip off his tongue with an ease bred through familiarity ; Bacon , Moore , Picasso , Degas … they all have been his teachers , through their images and writings on art .
Mrs Tiggy-winkle came tripping out to wave us off and Buster 's chains began to rattle inside his kennel .

But , although Jacques claims that it is massively frustrating to watch Julie tripping round the flat half-naked and not be able to touch her , Mr Moore fails to project the necessary dashed and deviant desire .
She rose , tripping round the table as if Benjamin had asked her for a dance .
He tripped backwards up the steps .
Elaine tripped in at four-thirty and George was well and truly asleep .
He trips off on his way .
Very pleased , Cheryl bade her goodbye and tripped off to the bus-stop , collecting Mrs. Yatton 's shoes on the way .
` It 's the drivers that run this town , " muttered one politician as he tripped off into the driveway .

When Perdita last saw her as Victor 's bimbo in 1981 , Sharon 's hair had been dyed the colour of strawberry jam , her splendid breasts had floated like beachballs out of her skin-tight polyester dress and her six-inch spike heels must have terrorized any lurking moles as she tripped on to the Rutshire pitch at treading-in time .
To come tripping through without a by-your-leave ?
A whore tripped by , her eyes ringed with black paint , her thick painted lips lustrous and red like rotting fruit .
